label: Biometric Categorisation
definition: Capability where assigning natural persons to specific categories happens on the basis of their biometric data unless ancillary to another commercial service and strictly necessary for objective technical reasons

label: Biometric Identification
definition: Capability where the automated recognition of physical, physiological, behavioural, and psychological human features are used for the purpose of establishing an individual’s identity by comparing biometric data of that individual to stored biometric data of individuals in a database

label: Biometric Identity Verification
definition: Purpose where AI is used for automated verification of the identity of natural persons by comparing biometric data of an individual to previously provided biometric data (one-to-one verification, including authentication)

label: Deep Fake Generation
definition: Capability to generate or manipulate image, audio or video content that resembles existing persons, objects, places or other entities or events and would falsely appear to a person to be authentic or truthful

label: Emotion Recognition
definition: Capability of a technology to identify or infer emotions or intentions of natural persons (on the basis of their biometric data)

label: High-Impact Capability in General Purpose AI Models
definition: ‘High-impact Capabilities’ in general purpose AI models means capabilities that match or exceed the capabilities recorded in the most  advanced general purpose AI models
